page.title: 01THE FAILAND PLATEAU.
page.content: The area is generally a {plateau} of around 100 metres high.The main land uses are 1.{farmland (pasture)}2.{ {woodland (decidous) }3.{sports fields {(golf)}and 4. {parkland.}Failand was the main village (which is in the south west). The two main roads are the A369 which runs from Bristol to Clevedon. We did not see any shops,factories,or any Police stations.There are few roads but they are long and straight. Also there are a few streams. There is a quarry about 80-100 metres deep and is in the west of our area.There are good views over Bristol and Avonmouth. We could see the M5 Motorway bridge over the river Avon.
